TopicTitle: [WIP][1.8.x] SSTULabs - Low Part Count Solutions (Orbiters, Landers, Lifters) - Dev Thread [11-18-18]

Articles.Content: The SRBs on the current version seem to have invariable costs, regardless of diameter or length. Also (and sorry for repeating this question), do the different heatshield weights affect max peak heating, or do they only change the shield's ablator resource amount?
Anyone else having the issue where the fairings don't appear? I don't think it's even a texture issue - it's like they just don't work.

[@Jimbodiah](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/152759-jimbodiah/) Your <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr> config works in my 1.8 save. The only thing I needed to change was the CH4/O ratio. In Nertea's methalox configs the ratio is 3:1, not 10:1.

So question about the SRBs. Currently on KSP v1.9.1 and SSTU v0.12.50.162  

Changing the core part of the <abbr title="Solid fuel Rocket Booster">SRB</abbr> which changes the length changes the thrust output only, total Solid Fuel doesn't change, mass doesn't change, and it seems that deltaV doesn't change either (implying isp is increasing) Is this working as designed?

> 
> 
> 12 hours ago, Akira\_R said:
> 
> 
> So question about the SRBs. Currently on KSP v1.9.1 and SSTU v0.12.50.162  
> 
> Changing the core part of the <abbr title="Solid fuel Rocket Booster">SRB</abbr> which changes the length changes the thrust output only, total Solid Fuel doesn't change, mass doesn't change, and it seems that deltaV doesn't change either (implying isp is increasing) Is this working as designed?
> 

Doesn't sound like it; changing the length (or diameter), should change the thrust + fuel amount, while maintaining a constant burn-time and <abbr title="Specific Impulse (rocketry) or Internet Service Provider">ISP</abbr>.  Delta-V is irrelevant for a single part, and depends upon the configuration of the entire craft in order to make a meaningful calculation.

TLDR: Something likely broke in one of the recent KSP updates (or has simply been broken for a long time and previously unreported).  Yet another thing to add to the 'todo' list if/when I have time to return to development tasks.

If I'm not mistaken, the culprit is RealPlume. See my bug report: [https://github.com/shadowmage45/SSTULabs/issues/823](https://github.com/shadowmage45/SSTULabs/issues/823)

[@Shadowmage](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/138730-shadowmage/) Can confirm what [@Al2Me6](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/203355-al2me6/) says, RealPlume seams to be causing the SRBs to not change their fuel amount when changing the core size, I'll go ahead and add my log to the github issue for you to peruse.
